Header: Spatial biology has the potential to advance precision medicine in immuno-oncology and inform the discovery of novel biomarkers. ChipCytometry is a novel precise spatial biology platform that combines iterative immunofluorescence staining with high-dynamic range imaging to facilitate quantitative phenotyping of dozens of biomarkers on the same sample. Here we present a high-plex ChipCytometry dataset of a clinical FFPE sample from a patient with non-small cell lung cancer.

Waypoints.Name: Tissue Overview
Waypoints.Description: A high-plex antibody panel was applied to this FFPE sample of a human lung cancer tissue to identify the major components of the tissue microenvironment including tumor and immune cell populations. The tumor rich region is marked by epithelial (EpCAM+) cells and various immune cell (CD45+) subpopulations are also present throughout this sample.

Waypoints.Name: Tumor Region
Waypoints.Description: Carcinomas are malignancies arising from epithelial tissue. This lung cancer specimen has been stained with epithelial cell adhesion molecule (EpCAM), a marker that stains the membrane of epithelial cells.

Waypoints.Name: Immune Region
Waypoints.Description: Immune cells (CD45+) are present throughout the tissue. This specimen is particularly rich with T cells, which were further categorized into various subpopulations including regulatory T cells (CD3+/CD4+/FoxP3), helper T cells (CD3+/CD4+), and cytotoxic T cells (CD3+/CD8+), during analysis.

Waypoints.Name: Immune Infiltrate
Waypoints.Description: The composition of tumor-infiltrating immune cells can serve as biomarkers for predicting response to treatment and survival in certain patient populations. In this specimen, myeloid cells (CD45+/CD14+) are found within the tumor region (EpCAM+) and may play a pro-tumor role.

Waypoints.Name: PD-L1 Expressing Tumor Cells
Waypoints.Description: Immune checkpoint inhibitors are a type of immunotherapy that block immune checkpoint proteins from binding to regulate the spread of cancer. PD-L1 is one protein of interest in immunotherapy that is expressed on a wide range of tumor cells, including certain lung cancers. Here, we observe co-expression of PD-L1 on many tumor cells (EpCAM+).

Waypoints.Name: Proliferating Immune Cells
Waypoints.Description: Immune cell proliferation is tightly regulated to ensure an effective response to infection while avoiding immunopathology. We observed proliferating immune cells (CD45+/Ki-67+) and analyzed additional proliferating T cell subsets, such as helper T cells, cytotoxic T cells, and regulatory T cells.
